messages.content: I am sitting on a bus. The woman sitting to my left is wearing orange. The man sitting to her right is wearing pink. What colour am I wearing?

I apologize, but I do not have enough information to determine what color you are wearing. I only have information about the colors of clothing of the people sitting to your left and right. I do not have any information about what you are wearing.
I am sitting to the womanâ€™s right.

I apologize again, but I still do not have enough information to determine what color you are wearing. The only information I have is:

1) You are sitting on a bus 
2) The woman sitting to your left is wearing orange
3) The man sitting to her right is wearing pink

This does not provide any information about what color clothing you have on. I do not have a way to determine that from the information provided.
If the woman is sitting to my left, then I must be the man sitting to her right.

Ah I see, thank you for clarifying. Based on the additional information, if the woman sitting to your left is wearing orange, and you are the man sitting to her right, then you must be wearing pink.

My apologies for the confusion, I should have asked follow up questions earlier to get clarification rather than stating that I did not have enough information. I will learn from this experience, and try to ask more clarifying questions in the future before concluding I do not have enough information to determine the answer.
